title: Jagatpur Kotaha
text:
Jagatpur Kotaha is a village in <a href="Dalmau">Dalmau</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. The nearest large town is <a href="Lalganj%2C%20Uttar%20Pradesh">Lalganj</a>, which is 11 km away. As of 2011, it has a population of 1,014 people, in 189 households. It has one middle school and no healthcare facilities.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Jagatpur Kotaha (as "Jagatpur Kotha") as comprising 1 hamlet, with a total population of 421 people (202 male and 219 female), in 77 households and 69 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 211 <a href="acre">acre</a>s.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Jagatpur Kotaha as having a population of 570 people, in 102 households, and having an area of 82.15 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
